title: Nominations Sent to the Senate for United States Attorney and Federal Judges: James Bishop, Megan Blair Benton, and Christopher Michael De Bono
summary: The White House announced that nominations have been sent to the United States Senate for three individuals: James Bishop to be United States Attorney for the Middle District of North Carolina for a four-year term; Megan Blair Benton to be United States District Judge for the Western District of Missouri; and Christopher Michael De Bono to be an Associate Judge (court not specified in the excerpt). The announcement is part of the routine process of providing nominations for federal positions to the Senate for confirmation.

title: Proclamation: Thanksgiving Day, 2025
summary: This Presidential Proclamation designates Thanksgiving Day, 2025 as a national observance. It outlines the historical origins of the holiday, tracing back to 1789 when President George Washington established the first National Day of Thanksgiving and noted the tradition of acknowledging Providence. The proclamation describes the day as an occasion for national reflection and gratitude and invites citizens and communities to observe appropriate ceremonies and acts of gratitude.

title: Proclamation Providing Regulatory Relief for Certain Stationary Sources to Promote American Coke-Oven Processing Security
summary: This presidential proclamation provides regulatory relief for certain stationary sources to promote American coke-oven processing security. It notes the steel industry's critical role in the U.S. economy and infrastructure and describes the rationale and scope of the regulatory relief.

title: Nominations to Federal Executive Branch Positions Announced
summary: The White House announced nominations sent to the Senate for several federal positions. The list includes Robert Cekada of Florida as Director of the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms, and Explosives; Carter Crow of Texas as General Counsel of the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission for a four-year term; Stuart Levenbach of Maryland as Director of the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection for a five-year term; and David Clay Fowlkes, with additional details not provided in the excerpt.

title: Proclamation on National Adoption Month, 2025
summary: A presidential proclamation designating National Adoption Month, 2025, and recognizing the importance of safe and nurturing homes for children. The document states that adoption can provide stability and a sense of belonging for children who need a family, and it commends adoptive parents and others who support children and families during National Adoption Month. It emphasizes continued attention to policies, programs, and resources that assist children in need of homes.
